message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
public static void main(String[] args) {
    String[] words = {"good","better", "best", "best", "first" , "last", "last", "last", "good"};
    List<String> list = new ArrayList<String>(Arrays.asList(words));
    removeDuplicates(list);
    for (String x : list){
        System.out.println(x);
    }
}

static void removeDuplicates(List<String> array){
    Set<String> uniqueWords = new LinkedHashSet<>();
    for(Iterator<String> it = array.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ){
        uniqueWords.add(it.next());
    }
    array.clear();
    array.addAll(uniqueWords);
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we are using Iterator to traverse through the list. We are adding each element to a LinkedHashSet, which automatically removes duplicates because Set only allows unique elements. We then clear the original list and add all elements from the set back to the list. This way, we are removing duplicates using equals() method implicitly as it is used in the add method of Set. The output is printed from the main method. Also, to populate the List faster, we are using Arrays.asList method.
